result.execSummary:
The defendant Reanna M. Moon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property fr. Person/Corpse, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit for 412 days, if revoked.
Expungement request denied by Court.

miscConds.notes: TBD by the State w/n 60 days.

If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge on each count.
*   Pay restitution in the sum of $ TBD    plus surcharges.
*   State shall have 60 days to determin restitution.
May not have contact with Jessica Brough, her residence or place of employment.  No contact w/ individuals who use or traffic illegal substances.

supervisions.notes: PROBATION HAS BEEN REVOKED.  TO COMMENCE FORTHWITH.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not have contact with Jessica Brough or any drug traffickers, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  (same conditions as probation)

ALL UNPAID COURT COSTS ARE STILL DUE.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State. DE appears in custody with Atty Cassi Baumgardner.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  1037 - Sentence recommendations.   Defendant is sentenced to 3 years in the WSP; 2 years Initial Confinement followed by 1 year of Extended Supervision. 513 days credit. DE (is not) eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Diane Caspari.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  10:54am-  Victim rights compliance.
Count 1-  Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 4 years w/conditions.  Court costs & DNA surcharge ordered.
Count 2-  Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 3 years w/conditions - concurrent to count 1.  Court costs & DNA surcharge ordered.
412 days sentence credit if revoked.  State is requesting restitution be ordered - amount to be determined within 60 days.  Appeal rights given.  Attorney Caspari requests DE be eligible for expungement.  Court denies request.
Amended
Acknowledgment of Plea Offer/Agreement

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Diane Caspari.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  9:40am-  Victim rights compliance.  Amended information filed.  DE acknowledges receipt & waives reading.  Matter is resolved.  Defendant admits to prior convictions.  Defendant entered a plea of guilty to amended counts 1 & 2; found guilty by the court.  Presentence Investigation ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 10:00 am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Diane Caspari.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  10:54am-  Victim rights compliance.  Attorney Caspari has provided the State w/ a counteroffer & the State needs time to review it.  No witness list or motions in limine filed by defense.  Matter remains on the court's trial calendar for 8/3/2015 at 9am.  Bond continued.
from DE    (Copy sent to DA's Office & Attorney Caspari on 5/4/2015)

Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Diane Caspari.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  2:01pm-  Victim rights compliance.  Bond motion filed by Attorney Caspari.  Arguments heard.  Court denies motion.  Due to conflict with the court's calendar, final pre-trial is rescheduled from July 10, 2015 to June 26, 2015 at 10:30 am.  Bond continued.

Defendant Reanna M. Moon appeared with Attorney Diane Rose Caspari.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Tracey Lynn Braun appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES: Arguments heard on DE's bond motion. The Court denies the motion; bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for 2/6/2015 at 11am.  Attorney Caspari notified in court.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  No appearance by the Defendant or Attorney Caspari.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  10:20am-  DE was not transported.  Victim rights compliance.  Attorney Caspari emailed the clerk this morning stating she is having car troubles & is unable to appear.  Court adjourns matter to a new date.  Clerk to coordinate a new date w/ Attorney Caspari & notify the DA's office.
to Modify Bail - filed by Attorney Diane Caspari    (1/8/2015 at 9am)

Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Diane Caspari.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  10:14am-  Victim rights compliance.  Attorney Caspari has not received an offer from the State.  ADA Braun will review the case & contact Attorney Caspari after determining whether an offer is appropriate.  Final pre-trial adjourned to January 8, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Bond continued.
Final pre-trial on November 25, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Due to ongoing jury trial (State v. Braithwaite), 10/17/2014 Final pre-trial is rescheduled to 11/25/2014 at 9:30am.  NTBS by the Court.
08-19-2014 Preliminary Hearing (NO DOCUMENT IN FILE AT TIME OF SCANNING PER INTEGRITY CHECK / PT)

Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Diane Caspari.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  11:50am-  Victim rights compliance.  Attorney Caspari recently received a release for electronic evidence & is requesting an adjournment to allow her to get the evidence.  Court grants request.  Final pre-trial adjourned to October 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Bond continued.
Copy of Letter from DA Zapt to Atty Caspari

District Attorney Robert Zapf appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Diane Caspari. Clerk LE. Atty. Caspari moves to dismiss repeater enhancer. Court denies motion.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 7. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 9-4-14 @ 10:30am. Bond continued.
to Preliminary Hearing

District Attorney Robert Zapf appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) without counsel. Clerk LE. Case was scheduled for preliminary hearing this morning. No appearance by Atty. Diane Caspari. Atty. Caspari states the SPD Office did not give her the preliminary hearing date. Preliminary hearing rescheduled to 8-21-14 @ 9:45am. Bond continued.
